questiontext.text:
Exercise

Find the area under \(f(x)={@f1@}\) from \(x={@a1@}\) to \(x={@b1@}\) given that the exponential function \({@f1@}\) is always positive. Give your answer in its exact form.

Area \(=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The following graph shows the graph of the function \(f(x)={@f1@}\) and the area we want to find. 

[[jsxgraph width='300px' height='250px']] JXG.Options.axis.ticks.insertTicks = false; /*don't insert extra ticks between major ticks*/ JXG.Options.axis.ticks.majorHeight =40; JXG.Options.text.fontSize=16; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.ticksDistance=1000000000; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, {boundingbox: {#BB#}, axis:true, showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false}); var f = board.jc.snippet('{#f1#}', true, 'x', true); var ff = board.create('functiongraph',[function(x) {var n={#n1#}; return Math.exp(n*x);}]); var i1 = board.create('integral',[{#[a,b]#},ff], {fillColor:'#003399',fillOpacity:0.15}); i1.curveLeft.setAttribute({visible:false}); /* hide the gliders */ i1.curveRight.setAttribute({visible:false}); i1.label.setAttribute({visible:false});/*hide the integral calculation*/ var xaxis = board.create('axis', [[0,0],[1,0]], {name:'x', withLabel: true, label: {position: 'rt', offset: [-5, 15] /* (in pixels)*/}}); board.create('ticks', [xaxis, {#[a1,b1]#}], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [0, -5],anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'top' }}); yaxis = board.create('axis', [[0, 0], [0, 1]], {name:'y', withLabel: true, label: {position: 'rt', offset: [-20, 0] }}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Area =\({\displaystyle\int_1^3 {@f1@}\ \mathrm{d}x}\) = \(\bigg[\displaystyle {@int(f1,x)@}\bigg]_1^3={@ta1@}\).
